main.name: Sayer Tindall
main.description: currently open to new opportunities. I'm a prior nuclear reactor operator for the US Navy transitioning into software development. Let's connect!
main.bio: My professional life began immediately after high school. At 18, I volunteered for the Navy's Nuclear Engineering program, completed the two-year school, and worked with two nuclear reactors onboard the USS Stennis for four years. I specialized in the electrical distribution systems, maintaining balance and continuity within the system. The program provided me with industry and operational experience at a young age. Seeing system-level operations during high intensity evolutions garnered an interest in the conceptualization, research, and design of other complex systems. I like to look at the big picture and determine how to make it bigger (or more efficient).
main.bioTwo: Currently looking for work in an exciting field that allows me to utilize my knowledge of back-end system design, operation, and logistics.
main.bioThree: Side note: This site was deployed using Docker and AWS because.. why not?
main.contactmessage: Feel free to reach out, always looking for new connections :)

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
